page.title: 03 WIGHILL continued
page.content: The Parish no longer has its own exclusive vicar but shares services with two neighbouring villages. Inside the church there is a splended tomb of a knight dated 1634. Until recently the Wesleyan Chapel, dated 1828 was used by the Methodists but it has now been sold. The school and the church run most of the local events such as wine and cheese parties and coffee mornings _ whilst in Wighill Park, pony club and caravan rallies are held. Many of the inhabitants of Wighill are older people and they like the peace and quiet of the village but there is not much for teenagers and children to do. You need transport to go anywhere and there are only two local buses a day.
